item.title: Interview with TU Bergakademie Freiberg
item.description:
Q&A withâ€¦ …Philip Duah, Master student (Sustainable Mining and Remediation Management) from Ghana and DAAD award winner.

Why did you decide to study at TUBAF?

My goal was to attend a top mining university that places great emphasis on internationalization, is known for mining research and innovation, and where I can study and conduct research at the intersection of mining, technology, and sustainability. I found out about TUBAF during my search and was immediately convinced.

You won the DAAD award. How are you involved with international students?

I have been part of the buddy program for new international students since my 2nd semester. I co-founded the Amnesty International university group and was its spokesperson. I also served on a committee of the Student Council (StuRa) and I helped organize the Festival of Cultures. Currently, I offer online consultations for students in my degree program as a tutor.

What opportunities are there to get involved at the university?

Within the university, we are always looking for committed students to support the committee work in the StuRa and the FSRs. It is also possible to participate in the buddy program to support new international students. Additionally, there are working groups, clubs and initiatives within the university that are always looking for new members. Getting involved in these areas is a form of personal development and is very rewarding.

What tip do you have for international students?

Don’t be afraid to ask questions. There is a lot of support here. You can always contact the International University Center. Without its support, for example, I would not have been able to complete my second internship. The Career Center also supports international students and already invited us to a meeting to better understand our career needs and to work out new strategies. For me, TUBAF is a cosmopolitan place where international exchange and diversity of opinions are always in the first place, both in research and teaching.

item.title: DAAD Prize for Outstanding Achievements by International Students at German Universities.
item.description:
On the 18th of October, 2022 I was awarded the 2022 DAAD Prize at TU Bergakademie Freiberg.

The German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) via German Universities, every year, awards the DAAD Prize for outstanding achievements by international Students at German Universities. This prize is given to International Students who complete their studies at German Universities and who stand out for both their academic prowess and their exceptional social or intercultural engagement.The University is in charge of selecting the recipient of the prize. The final decision-making authority is the Rectorate of the University.

I thank the DAAD, TU Bergakademie Freiberg and the German Foreign Office for the honor and recognizing my contribution to the German Society.
